SoftwareType.Name: Game
SoftwareType.Description: Games are things you play. YOU WILL NOW COMMENCE ENJOYMENT

Category.Name: Hockey
Category.Description: Create a Hockey Game (Like NHL)

Category.Name: Basketball
Category.Description: Create a Basketball Game (Like NBA 2K)

Category.Name: Football
Category.Description: Touchdown! Create a football game (Like Madden NFL or NCAA)

Category.Name: Mountainbiking
Category.Description: Go for a bike ride through the back hills....or go off some jumps

Category.Name: Skateboarding
Category.Description: Shread The Half-Pipes in A Skateboarding Game

Category.Name: FPS
Category.Description: First Person Shooter(s)(Like Call of Duty)

Category.Name: Life Simulation Game
Category.Description: Games in which Players Design and Create their own players and is a simulation of LIFE (Like The Sims)

Category.Name: PVE
Category.Description: Games in which Players Fight Against Everything In This Game, Players Must Work Together InOrder To Survive

Category.Name: PVP
Category.Description: Games in which Players Fight Other Players

Category.Name: RPG
Category.Description: Games in which one assumes a role, and then plays it within a set of given rules which shape the contextual outcomes of events

Category.Name: Adventure
Category.Description: Puzzles. Not just point and click, but also text adventures, and, later, 3D adventures with a focus on puzzle instead of action

Category.Name: Simulation
Category.Description: You're playing one!

Category.Name: Sports
Category.Description: Competitive

Category.Name: RTS
Category.Description: Real Time Strategy

Category.Name: First Person Adventure
Category.Description: Doom

Category.Name: Platformer
Category.Description: Leap on stuff and stuff. Remember Putty?

Category.Name: Fighting Game
Category.Description: Two (or more) players square off against each other as avatars with martial arts knowhow or really big sticks. Feet Strighter!

Category.Name: Brawler
Category.Description: Oof! Biff! Bam! Related to the scroller, this variety of scrolling screen game has you - and possibly friends - fight enemies on a succession of screens. Bosses were a really big deal

Category.Name: Projectile Hell
Category.Description: Top down or side on, this variety of scroller involves projectile dodging and positioning challenges for the player. Again bosses were a big deal. Tyrian too

Category.Name: Third Person Adventure
Category.Description: Like an adventure but not actually - the emphasis here is not on puzzles, although they are probably present in some simple form, but on the action. Also the drowning

Category.Name: Tactical Shooter
Category.Description: Cover, flanking, smart enemies. Sightlines. ITS YER TEKTIKS

Category.Name: Racing
Category.Description: Varying much through time, racing games have been hard simulations and fun-focused arcade games too(rismo)

Category.Name: Flight Sim
Category.Description: Aircraft go whoooosh. Wallet go empty

Category.Name: Tycoon
Category.Description: Business management games, often also space management - mingled with sandbox beauty generators with delusions of business grandeur. There's always money in the Lemonade Stand

Category.Name: Sports Management
Category.Description: Go sports team! Now go other sports team!

Category.Name: Grand Strategy
Category.Description: When you hate the outside world, imagine bombing it!

Category.Name: Real Time Tactics
Category.Description: Pew pew!

Category.Name: Clicker
Category.Description: Mindless moneyspinning fun

Category.Name: Battle Royale
Category.Description: Fight to The Death!

Category.Name: Wild West
Category.Description: Battle it out in the wild west!

Category.Name: Thirdperson/Firstperson Shooter
Category.Description: Games like Ghost Recon, Call of Duty, and Arma!

Feature.Name: Improve Worldspace
Feature.Description: Create a unique world space

Feature.Name: Improve Graphics
Feature.Description: Update the graphics for your game!

Feature.Name: Improve Quality
Feature.Description: Update the quality of your game!

Feature.Name: Updates
Feature.Description: Allows updates to occur for the game

Feature.Name: Micro-Transactions
Feature.Description: Allows Players To Purchase ex. Credits in A Game

Feature.Name: Loot-Crates
Feature.Description: Like CSGO or Call of Duty

Feature.Name: Player Customization/Creation
Feature.Description: Allows modification of In-Game Avatar(s)

Feature.Name: Artificial Intelligence v1
Feature.Description: AI v1

Feature.Name: DLC Content
Feature.Description: Allows modification of game files to create extra levels, game mechanics and more.

Feature.Name: Worldbuilding
Feature.Description: Text is the core of any game, and this is that. Story, background, etc

Feature.Name: Simple help system
Feature.Description: Basic tooltips

Feature.Name: Complex help system
Feature.Description: Tooltips, complicated tutorials, etc

Feature.Name: Single Playscreen
Feature.Description: Yup. Literally just one screen. That's the entire game. If this is an adventure, of course, that one screen will be text. Otherwise, think Pong, or Asteroids

Feature.Name: 2D rendering
Feature.Description: Everyone loves double D. Maybe even with colour.

Feature.Name: Wireframe 3D
Feature.Description: Triple your D, but early. There are colours.

Feature.Name: 3D rendering
Feature.Description: Triple your D but now with other stuff filling the stuff so it's much more stuff than before. COLOURS EVERYWHERE

Feature.Name: GAPI Integration
Feature.Description: Hook into the OS' 2D and 3D graphics API and leverage driver capabilities for a superior end-user experience. tl;dr more pretty

Feature.Name: AGAPI Integration
Feature.Description: Hook into the OS' 2D and 3D "advanced" graphics API and leverage driver capabilities for a superior end-user experience. tl;dr even more pretty

Feature.Name: HAPI Integration
Feature.Description: Hook into the OS' 2D and 3D holographic API and leverage driver capabilities for a superior end-user experience. tl;dr holodecks

Feature.Name: Single-channel audio
Feature.Description: Just Crackle.

Feature.Name: Dual-channel audio
Feature.Description: No, not Crackle and Pop. Hopefully.

Feature.Name: 8-bit audio
Feature.Description: Eventually, simply awe.

Feature.Name: HD audio
Feature.Description: Many bits in your awww.

Feature.Name: Touch support
Feature.Description: Poke it ;)

Feature.Name: Advanced input
Feature.Description: Wheels, joysticks, etc.

Feature.Name: Neurohaptics
Feature.Description: A disco in your head! Hopefully not

Feature.Name: 2D art - engine-augmented
Feature.Description: Help the developer along with some prepackaged assets.

Feature.Name: 3D art - engine-augmented
Feature.Description: Like 2D assets, but with an extra dimension.

Feature.Name: Simple Physics
Feature.Description: What! Why apple go fally!

Feature.Name: Advanced Physics
Feature.Description: e=mc^2

Feature.Name: Sequential Events
Feature.Description: A. B. C. D. Not always as boring as it sounds here. Pacman was fun, right? And all those adventure games...

Feature.Name: Dynamic Events
Feature.Description: Doors can open. Maybe things can get set on fire. Things can explode. Whatever. This feature is things that require user input and that are events.

Feature.Name: Dynamic Storytelling
Feature.Description: Not only are the events dynamic, but they tell a story.

Feature.Name: Pre-rendered cutscenes
Feature.Description: Exposition through animation, but not rendered by the game engine

Feature.Name: Simple in-engine cutscenes
Feature.Description: Cutscenes rendered by the game engine, dynamically, based on user actions.

Feature.Name: Complex in-engine cutscenes
Feature.Description: Cutscenes rendered by the game engine, dynamically, based on user actions.

Feature.Name: Chargen
Feature.Description: You could be a pretty princess!

Feature.Name: Combat system
Feature.Description: How am destroy?!

Feature.Name: Inventory
Feature.Description: It puts the things in the rucksack or it gets the hose again

Feature.Name: Procedurally Scheduled AI Events
Feature.Description: Like in a game unmentionable that is puddle-deep and Pacific-wide

Feature.Name: Puzzles
Feature.Description: Ask a hint system

Feature.Name: Hint system
Feature.Description: I'm not telling you

Feature.Name: Simple SimEngine
Feature.Description: Some sort of simple sim

Feature.Name: Complex SimEngine
Feature.Description: A simulation which is not trivial

Feature.Name: Very Complex SimEngine
Feature.Description: One does not simply ask what a very complex simulation is; one must experience it for themselves

Feature.Name: Shallow Tactical Simulation
Feature.Description: Depending on the sport (or other tactical simulation), this enables the players/teams/whatever to act in ways that are at least semi-rational inside the rules of that sport

Feature.Name: Deep Tactical Simulation
Feature.Description: Striving for deeper, more realistic sporting (or other tactical) simulation

Feature.Name: Collision Engine
Feature.Description: Thing hit other thing

Feature.Name: Simple Tech Tree
Feature.Description: The manual goes pshhh on the desk

Feature.Name: Complex Tech Tree
Feature.Description: The manual goes WHOOMPF on the desk

Feature.Name: Individual Unit AI
Feature.Description: AKA "pathfinding nightmares"

Feature.Name: Projectiles
Feature.Description: Pew pew pew

Feature.Name: Variable gravity
Feature.Description: WHAT EVEN ARE UP

Feature.Name: Physics puzzles
Feature.Description: Either also known as "confusing as hell" or "masterful", depending on execution

Feature.Name: Flanking AI
Feature.Description: Games: teaching children that it is always safest to stab in the back

Feature.Name: Cover system
Feature.Description: Hiding behind a thing so other things can't hit you with things

Feature.Name: Open world
Feature.Description: Like a whole... world, and it's... you know, open

Feature.Name: Mod support
Feature.Description: You can mod this feature out of the game if you want

Feature.Name: Internet Multiplayer
Feature.Description: For a more global game feature.

Feature.Name: LAN Multiplayer
Feature.Description: For a more local game feature.

Feature.Name: Extra Lives
Feature.Description: The ability to not die immediately, but instead die repeatedly. Torture!

Feature.Name: Checkpoint Saves
Feature.Description: Stores player progress periodically.

Feature.Name: Free Save and Load
Feature.Description: The player may save at their own discretion, possibly alongside a checkpoint system.

Feature.Name: Permadeath
Feature.Description: Dead is dead, no save or load here... though this is often an additional option on top of a checkpoint or freesave system

Feature.Name: Character Personalities
Feature.Description: Social interactions are abstracted to a spreadsheet of values indicating character compatibilities to produce random-seeming emergent outcomes

Feature.Name: Character Skill Indexing
Feature.Description: An important element of management games is a sea of seemingly-important data to absorb the user for the rest of their marriage and/or natural life

Feature.Name: Team Chemistry
Feature.Description: A seemingly complex but actually simple way to achieve not actually random but pretty diverse outcomes

Feature.Name: 2D Tag Team
Feature.Description: Multiple players take on AI, or other players, in various formats including party modes and network play

Feature.Name: 3D Tag Team
Feature.Description: Multiple players take on AI, or other players, in various formats including party modes and network play

Feature.Name: Realistic Vehicular Physics
Feature.Description: Vehicle specific physics

Feature.Name: Realistic Flight Physics
Feature.Description: Vehicle specific physics

Feature.Name: Stock Market Simulation
Feature.Description: Simulation of stock markets

Feature.Name: Basic Economic Simulation
Feature.Description: Simulation of economies

Feature.Name: Complex Economic Simulation
Feature.Description: Simulation of economies

Feature.Name: Complex Competitors
Feature.Description: Simulation of economies

Feature.Name: Good Chains
Feature.Description: Simulation of chains of goods, ie from production to market

Feature.Name: Complex Ballistics
Feature.Description: Not just projectiles but really complex ones

Feature.Name: Ability System
Feature.Description: The creation of a system of "abilities" used to attack or defend against enemies in a game system

Feature.Name: Hero Design
Feature.Description: The design of heroes for action games
